medical_history.chief_complaint: Symptoms of memory loss, depression, and mild tremor of both upper extremities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient sought medical attention in 1991. The symptoms began with memory loss and mild tremor. By 1995, the tremor became more prominent affecting fine motor movements. In 1998, marked problems with expressive speech developed, including stuttering and paraphasic errors. Symptoms worsened over time, including increased tremor, rigidity, and cognitive decline.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of depression diagnosed in 1991, treated with fluoxetine. The patient had a diagnosis of diffuse Lewy body disease confirmed by pathologic examination.
